* Abstracts the Commands obtained from user input.

*

Command nests its child classes inside its abstraction, as there is
* a small number of available commands that can be called through the UI.

*

Every nested Command should be assigned a corresponding CommandType enum.
* Runs the command specified by the specific command.
* @param tasks The Collection of Tasks stored by TrackerBot.
* @param uiHandler The UI object of TrackerBot, to pass status messages into.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, UiHandler uiHandler);
* Runs the command specified by the specific command, as a mass operation.
* @param tasks The Collection of Tasks stored by TrackerBot.
* @param uiHandler The UI object of TrackerBot, to pass status messages into.
* @throws TrackerBotException if the command cannot be executed as a mass operation.
public abstract void executeAsMassOp(TaskList tasks, UiHandler uiHandler) throws TrackerBotException;

*

Depending on the keyword passed in, the method will generate an
* appropriate instance of a subtype of Command. Currently, this method can generate

*
  • AddCommand, to add Tasks into the Tracker.

*
  • DeleteCommand, to remove Tasks from the Tracker.

*
  • FindCommand, to find all Tasks matching a substring.

*
  • ListCommand, to display Tasks in the Tracker.

*
  • ExitCommand, to tell the Tracker to exit.

*
  • UnknownCommand, which will throw an error on execute.
* @param keyword The keyword passed in by the user input.
* @param commandField The description of the user input.
* @return Some subtype of Command related to keyword.
public static Command of(CommandType keyword, String commandField) {
* Enumerates the possible Command types that exist in the Command class.

*

CommandType should directly mirror the number of nested implementations of the

/** Command to mark a task to be complete. **/
/** Command to mark a task as incomplete. **/
/** Command to search for a task. **/
/** Command to denote an unknown keyword call. **/
/** The String representation of the enum. Used to parse the command into enum. **/

*

Enum constructors are implicitly private, so the tag is not included.
* @param keyword The keyword of the task.
* Gets the keyword of the enum CommandType.
* @return The associated String keyword with the Command.

* Constructs a Deadline using a String array, for use in save parsing.

* the deadline date to the end of the toString.
* @return "[D]" prefixed to task.toString(), and "(by: [deadline])" postfixed to task.toString().

The Task class abstracts each checklist item inside a Reminder-Type app.

*

private static final String DATE_INPUT_FORMAT = "d/M[/yyyy][ HHmm]";
private static final String DATE_UI_FORMAT = "dd MMM yyyy, EEE @ hh:mma";
/** Prevent the instantiation of TaskDateHandler object. **/
* Converts the Input String into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param input The input String to parse into a Date object.
* The String should be in the format: [d/M/yyyy HHmm]
*              The year and time are optional. If not given, the year is assumed
*              to be the current year, and the time is assumed to be 0000.
* @return The LocalDateTime object from the parsed String
* @throws TrackerBotException if the input does not match the format string
throw new TrackerBotException("Error in parsing input to date: " + e.getMessage()
+ "\nAdditional Date Fields should be in the format DD/MM(/YYYY)( HHmm)");
* Converts the start date and end date inputs into a pair of LocalDateTime.

*

The inputs should be in the format: [d/M/yyyy HHmm]

*

The year and time are optional. If not given, the year is assumed
* to be the current year, and the time is assumed to be 0000.
* @param fromStr The start date input String to parse into a Date object.
* @param toStr The end date input String to parse into a Date object.
* @return A LocalDateTime array of length 2, parsed from the input Strings
* @throws TrackerBotException if the input does not match the format string, or
*                             if the start date is not earlier than the end date.

throw new TrackerBotException("Start date should be before end date.");

assertEquals("Cannot track task without description.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("[E][ ] Test Input (from: 01 Dec 2000, Fri @ 12:00AM | to: 09 Dec 2000, Sat @ 12:00AM)",
// There should be an Illegal State Exception - this is not caught by the program.
* This parses user input to Date. As the parse can be variable with optional
* fields, we test to see if the parser handles bad input properly.
assertEquals("Error in parsing input to date: "
+ "Text '' could not be parsed at index 0"
+ "\nAdditional Date Fields should be in the format DD/MM(/YYYY)( HHmm)", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Error in parsing input to date: "
+ "Text '21//2 2359' could not be parsed at index 3"
+ "\nAdditional Date Fields should be in the format DD/MM(/YYYY)( HHmm)", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Error in parsing input to date: "
+ "Text '21/2/20 2359' could not be parsed, unparsed text found at index 4"
+ "\nAdditional Date Fields should be in the format DD/MM(/YYYY)( HHmm)", e.getMessage());
